Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Horwedja with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard and crossed hands holding a relief adze, a hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the leg section is inscribed with nine rows of Hieroglyphic text; more text at the top of the back-pillar; plinth beneath the feet.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum (Department of Ceramics)
